sense.name: a one-piece, skirted garment for females
sense.examples: These are inexpensive copies of designer dresses. The bride wore a sleeveless ankle-length dress in white. These dresses are for toddlers.

sense.name: a distinctive style of clothing
sense.examples: The dancers were wearing traditional African dress from their tribe. The soldiers' battle dress is desert camouflage, boots and helmet. Office dress has become more casual over the years.

sense.name: formal wear
sense.commentary: DRESS[+artifact][+clothing][+style][+characterized][+formal] Note: a narrow usage of Sense 2 that means formal, dress-up clothing
sense.examples: Did the invitation indicate that it was dress or casual? The naval officers were in dress uniform. John put on his dress shoes for the wedding.
